author: Reuters Editorial
title: China's central bank says it will skip OMOs on Wednesday
text:
SHANGHAI (Reuters) - China’s central bank said it will skip open market operations on Wednesday as liquidity levels in the banking system were “relatively high”.
FILE PHOTO: A Chinese national flag flutters outside the headquarters of the People's Bank of China, the Chinese central bank, in Beijing, China April 3, 2014. B REUTERS/Petar Kujundzic/File Photo On a net basis, the People’s Bank of China (PBOC) will drain 20 billion yuan ($3.18 billion) from the market for the day as the same amount in reverse repos is due to expire on Wednesday.
The PBOC drained a net 10 billion yuan from the money market last week.
Reporting by the Shanghai Newsroom
